data.title: Add remove cursor when there are multiple cursors and cmd clicking on it
data.body:
Closes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6909

![deselect](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5764316/8105547/6d6a5a9c-103a-11e5-80d1-3fe6b7ad1e7d.gif)

 `Cmd / Ctrl-Click` -ing on a cursor when there are multiple cursors will remove that cursor. 

If there is only the one cursor and it is `Cmd / Ctrl-Click`-ed, nothing will happen.

data.title: Text select not aligned with content
Issue with syntax coloring/leading spaces (in XML)
data.body:
There is a small issue with syntax coloring which I have observed in XML files (I am not sure if it occurs with other syntaxes). I think the issue did not occur in previous versions of Atom.
![xml_coloring_bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11692818/8103109/30118bac-1026-11e5-8e36-1e18279269da.png)
As you can see, the color spans are moved by one character forward on the lines which only contain an XML attribute. The issue occurs only if the number of leading spaces on these lines is even.
(Atom 0.207.0, Ubuntu 14.04 64-bit)

data.title: Fixed 'setBufferRange' documentation parameter name
Windows failure to start atom
data.body:
I dragged a file onto the atom editor and it immediately crashed.

The program will start but will crash again before the UI shows up. There is no useful output on the command line.

I suspect that the file is somehow causing this, and every time it loads it tries to get this bad file.

C:\Users\John\Dropbox\salsa>atom --version
[4764:0611/000926:INFO:CONSOLE(0)] 0.208.0

data.title: Why is the font so big by default?
data.body: The default font size seems extremely large compared to every other editor I've used. Why is it so big?

data.title: Re-introduce atom.directory-searcher service v0.1.0.
data.body: This reverts the revert of https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/7022 and adds the appropriate fixes to both `workspace.coffee` and `spec/workspace-spec.coffee` to address the issue that was caught by the test failure in the `find-and-replace` package.

data.title: Fix misattributed package load/activate notifications
data.body:
There were cases where the error thrown loading/activating a package was not properly attributed to the package because of the stack trace.
- [x] Add path information to CSON errors https://github.com/atom/season/pull/15

Fixes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6227
### Before

![screen shot 2015-06-10 at 3 01 35 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/671378/8095274/aa90660a-0f81-11e5-8631-d1aebd7e3b91.png)
### After

![screen shot 2015-06-10 at 3 01 47 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/671378/8095271/a864ab16-0f81-11e5-9fba-b40d6a45c133.png)

data.title: Updating UI never indicates when the update is finished.
data.body:
To reproduce:
1. Go to Available Updates.
2. Make sure you have packages that need updates.
3. Hit "Update All".

The Update button within the package cards will change to ":cloud: Updating..." with the stripes running right to left. Leave this page open and come back 5 minutes later. It will still say updating. But if you reload Atom, the packages will be updated.

This is in the latest version. (0.208.0)

data.title: Cursor position not respected with auto indentation on paste
data.body:
I love auto indentation on paste, and it's a a very useful feature. However, currently in Atom it seems to be a little bit too smart, and taking control away from the coder.

The problem I have with it is that It doesn't respect where you put your cursor before pasting:

![ex1](https://www.dropbox.com/s/tcun18tsprgszw2/cursor%20position%20not%20respected.gif?dl=1)

In my opinion, the cursor position should be used as a baseline for the pasting operation, _not_ whatever Atom thinks is the baseline based on surrounding code.

If I want to paste something starting at a certain indentation, I would like Atom to respect that, even if Atom thinks the proper indentation is different. Right now, it's just causing frustration, because I have to paste something and then correct the auto indentation, fighting against the editor, rather than having the editor do the work for me.

Sublime does this well (reinstalled it just to record this):

![ex2](https://www.dropbox.com/s/uokpiuri56pxgtn/cursor%20position%20respected%20in%20sublime.gif?dl=1)

Is it possible to update Atom's behaviour to respect the cursor position on paste, or at least provide an option to enable/disable this behaviour?

data.title: All windows not remembered if exiting with unsaved files.
data.body:
With multiple windows open and some of them with files with unsaved changes, when quitting Atom it prompts about those unsaved files. Regardless of the option chosen for the prompt, only the window with the last prompt to close is reopened.

Experiencing this on _OS X 10.10.3_ and _Atom 0.208_.

data.title: Fullscreen state is forgotten for all but one window.
data.body:
With multiple fullscreen windows open, exit then start Atom and notice only one of them is opened in fullscreen.

Experiencing this on _OS X 10.10.3_ and _Atom 0.208_.

data.title: Search function only searches one pane at a time
data.body: If you split horizontally with two different files open, the search function will only search the most recently edited file.

data.title: 'Copy' command when nothing selected should do nothing
data.body:
Behavior in the vast majority of editors/programs is that if you execute the 'Copy' command (Control/Command + C) when no text is selected is that nothing happens.

Atom instead copies the current line. There's already a nice duplicate-line command, making the behavior not quite necessary.

The real annoyance is that many, many times I mean to press Ctrl-V but I press Ctrl-C instead. So I lose my selection and have to go copy the original text again.

data.title: "Open file with..." Atom ? Why you change folder every update ?
data.body:
Hello,

I don't really know how to get the correct Google or GitHub search to find the solution to my problem : 

When Atom is updated, the folder name containing the atom.exe changes ! The problem is that Windows obviously doesn't get anything about this, and just tell me "There is no Atom.exe in here"

Updates are awesome, I really love them, but why change the folder everytime ? Is there a solution ?
The problem is mainly that finding my installation folder is long (deep into my Users folder) and FileZilla require that I link a file to a .exe to open a cache version of it

data.title: EditorView - Underlayer not displayed
data.body:
In Atom 207 the EditorView "underlayer" went missing (at least on the Windows version) ...
However, if created on demand it still displayed (https://github.com/JohnMurga/rulerz/commit/d28cb13c54939d4c92c3a016b0ed2a734eae3320)

Now on version 208 it does not display, which neutralizes a few packages that depend on it.

data.title: Error when previous session file was opened from network share that is not available
data.body:
To Reproduce:
1. Open a file from a network share, e.g. \\MyServer\Logfiles\error.log then close Atom.
2. Open Atom again when the network share is no longer present, e.g. on a different network at home.

**Atom Version**: 0.208.0
**System**: Microsoft Windows 10 Pro Insider Preview
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught Error: UNKNOWN: unknown error, open '\\cpc-23949-001\LogFiles\'

data.title: Atom not opening
data.body:
I'm running Ubuntu 12.04 in Virtualbox. I've downloaded and installed the latest .deb file from the Atom repo. The install went fine. I launch Atom and the processes starts, but Atom does not open. 

Any ideas?

data.title: Guard for atom windows w/ no webContents
data.body: Fixes #7105.

data.title: Focus on launch tweaks
data.body:
Only grab focus once when launching instead of multiple times.

Closes #6828

data.title: Red Error popup does not respect sourcemaps
data.body: When there is an error in a babel transpiled file with an external sourcemap, the red error popup does not use the line number and filename from the original source.

data.title: Atom steals window focus like 4 times on startup
data.body:
To repro:
1. Start up Atom, tab to your favorite chat application while you wait for it to load
2. It steals focus
3. Tab back and keep typing
4. It steals focus
5. Tab back and struggle to type
6. It steals focus
7. :crying_cat_face:
